(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

So for each gene, the probability of producing the dominant allele is 1/2. For all five, the probability is (1/2)^5=1/32, which is part (a). For (b), the probability that a particular gene pair is homozygous. For each gene pair, the probability of being AA or aa is 2*(1/2)*(1/2)=1/2. Since there are five independent gene pairs, the probability that all are AA or aa is (1/2)^5=1/32. But the question is about the proportion of the total progeny that is homozygous. Homozygous refers to having the same allele for both copies, so for each gene pair, the probability of being homozygous is 1/2. Since there are five gene pairs, the expected number of homozygous individuals would be 5*(1/2)*probability of having two copies. Wait, this seems complicated. For each gene pair, the probability of being homozygous is 1/2, as calculated earlier. Since there are five independent gene pairs, the probability that all are homozygous would be (1/2)^5=1/32. But the question is about the proportion of the total progeny that is homozygous, not the probability. Wait, maybe it's the number of homozygous individuals versus the total number of individuals. If each gene pair has a 1/2 chance of being homozygous, and there are five independent gene pairs, the expected number of homozygous individuals would be 5*(1/2)*probability of having two copies. Given that, I'll go with option E.

The correct answer is E

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

full_cot:
<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>
